sentence.Network_en: A wager is a fool's argument.
I wager that It'shall be so.
She was willing to wager that he didn't own the apartment he lived in.
sentence.Network_cn: 她愿意打赌他居住的公寓并不属于他。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (also in the sense 'solemn pledge'): from Anglo-Norman French wageure, from wager 'to wage'

entry.def: If you wager on the result of a horse race, football match, or other event, you give someone a sum of money which they give you back with extra money if the result is what you predicted, or which they keep if it is not.

example.ex: Just because people wagered on the Yankees did not mean that they liked them...
example.tran: 人们将赌注下在扬基队上并不说明就喜欢他们。

example.ex: Golfers had wagered a good deal of money on Nick Faldo winning the championship.
example.tran: 高尔夫球手投下重注赌尼克·法尔多夺冠。

entry.def: If you say that you will wager that something is the case, you mean you are confident that it is the case.

example.ex: She was willing to wager that he didn't own the apartment he lived in...
example.tran: 她愿意打赌他居住的公寓并不属于他。

example.ex: I'll wager she'll still make the same impact when she's 70.
example.tran: 我敢打赌，她就算到了70岁，影响力也会不减当年。

means.word_mean: 2. the money risked on a gamble
1. stake on the outcome of an issue;

sentences.sentence: "She played all her money on the dark horse"

means.word_mean: 2. maintain with or as if with a bet;
